Title: Digital Twin Cities: Framework and Global Practices
Claim: Digital twin technology enables customized public services in areas such as hospitals, classrooms, and nursing homes, directly enhancing citizens' quality of life. The report also highlights global urban digital twin use cases across city management, infrastructure, environmental goals, and public health.
Method: The source presents global digital twin city use cases by detailing case overviews, typical scenarios, and summaries, collated from various examples.
Why it matters: This source is highly relevant as it directly identifies specific public services and institutions that benefit from digital twin applications, alongside real-world examples of their implementation in urban contexts.

Title: Advancing Intra and Inter-City Urban Digital Twins: An Updated Review
Venue: Journal of Planning Education and Research
Claim: This source identifies various domain-specific use cases for urban digital twins, including those relevant to public services such as transportation, environment & energy, disaster response, urban operations, and governance. It underscores the importance of standardizing terminology for classifying these diverse applications.
Method: The source presents an updated review of existing literature, synthesizing findings from other researchers who have cataloged urban digital twin use cases.
Why it matters: This source is highly relevant as it directly identifies and categorizes specific urban digital twin use cases across various public service domains.

Title: Making (common) sense of Urban Digital Twins with Q methodology
Claim: Urban Digital Twins offer public service use cases such as improving urban resilience against natural disasters and pandemics, leveraging 3D visualization and easy, game-like user interaction.
Method: The study uses Q methodology to understand various perspectives on Urban Digital Twins.
Limitations: Limitations of the study's method or scope are not stated in the evidence.
Why it matters: This source directly identifies specific public service use cases for urban digital twins, such as enhancing resilience, and highlights key features enabling their effective deployment.

Title: Challenges of urban digital twins: A systematic review and a Delphi expert survey
Claim: This source highlights that urban digital twins face various technical and non-technical challenges across their life cycle, indicating a significant demand for best practices and use cases to improve their adoption. Understanding these challenges can help stakeholders comprehend the current development status.
Method: The study identifies and maps aggregated challenges of urban digital twins across their life cycle, drawing insights from expert panellists.
Why it matters: This source is relevant as it explicitly identifies a demand for urban digital twin use cases, which is critical for exploring specific public services applications.
